Congratulations ! 

You've just installed .NET API for Image Processing.

Now you could use powerful functionality, that enables your .NET applications to draw as well as perform basic to advanced level processing of raster & vector images.

Aspose.Imaging for .NET offers robust image compression and high processing speed through native byte access and a range of efficient algorithms. It not only manipulate, export and convert images but also lets you dynamically draw objects using pixel manipulation and Graphics Path.

API Reference : https://apireference.aspose.com/imaging/net/aspose.imaging
Product page: https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net
Github page: https://github.com/aspose-imaging/Aspose.Imaging-for-.NET

Imaging API Features :

- Create, load & edit images; 
- Convert images to a variety of formats;  
- Various image filters and effects (gaussian, blur, median, grayscale, binarization, dithering etc); 
- Crop, resize & rotate-flip; 
- Image deskew; 
- Support animated multi-frame images Uniform image page (frame) processing; 
- Draw images using Graphics (graphics path and different geometric shapes); 
- Image masking; 
- Memory optimization strategies; 
- Draw text while controlling the font aspects; 
- Save SVG with fonts embedded or exported;
- Set image properties and metadata;
- Draw raster images with graphics;
- Draw vector images;
- Converting images to various formats;
- Apply masking as well as Median & Wiener filters;
- Crop, rotate & resize images via API;
- De-skew & transform images.

New Features & Enhancements in Version 23.2

- Develop plug-in licensing
- Keep transparency, when indexing Png images

For the detailed notes, please visit https://docs.aspose.com/imaging/net/aspose-imaging-for-net-23-2-release-notes/.

Now you can read & Write Image Formats. 

Raster Formats: JPEG2000, JPEG, BMP, TIFF, GIF, PNG, ICO
Metafiles: EMF, WMF
Other: WEBP, APNG, SVG

Save Images As
Fixed: PDF
Design: PSD

Read Image Formats
Various: DICOM, DjVu, DNG, ODG, CMX, CDR, DIB, OTG, FODG, EPS, TGA, DXF.

Platform Independence
Aspose.Imaging for .NET can be used to develop applications on Windows Desktop (x86, x64), Windows Server (x86, x64), Windows Azure. Also Aspose.Imaging is Linux compatible. The supported platforms include .NET Framework version 2.0, Net Standard 2.0, Net5.0 or higher.
Plugin licenses are supported only for .NET Standard 2.0, .NET Core 3.1, NET5 and higher.

Plugin license support

Do not need full API ? Plugin licenses allow you to get access to specific features.

Following features are includes in this MVP :

Aspose.Imaging Conversion feature

Allows converson between supported image formats (https://docs.aspose.com/imaging/net/supported-file-formats/)

See conversion landing pages (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/conversion/) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/conversion

Aspose.Imaging Image merge feature

Allows to merge of several images into one.

See image merge landing pages (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/merge/) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/image-merge

Aspose.Imaging Image Image Album feature

Allows to merge of several images into image album in the tiff, dicom, pdf formats.

See image merge landing pages (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/merge/) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/image-merge

Aspose.Imaging Resize for .NET

Allows to resize the image, making downsampling or upsampling.

See image resize landing pages (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/resize/) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/image-resize

Aspose.Imaging Crop for .NET

Allows to crop the image selecting the rectangular part.

See image crop landing pages (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/crop/) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/image-crop

Following features coming soon :

Aspose.Imaging Rotate-Flip for .NET

Allows to flip or rotate the image.

See documentation (https://docs.aspose.com/imaging/net/crop-rotate-and-resize-images/#rotate-and-flip-an-image) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/flip-rotate

Aspose.Imaging Deskew for .NET

Allows to deskew the image, correcting after scan defects.

See documentation (https://docs.aspose.com/imaging/net/deskew-image/) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/image-deskew

Aspose.Imaging Image Effect for .NET

Allows to apply various effects and filters to the image.

They are :

Grayscale examples (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/grayscale/)

Dither examples (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/dither/)

Binarize examples (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/binarize/)

Adjust examples (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/adjust/)

Image filters (gaussian and others) examples (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/filter/)

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/photo-filter

Aspose.Imaging Animation for .NET

Allows to create animation (gif, apng, webp) from the images.

See documentation (https://docs.aspose.com/imaging/net/creating-and-manipulating-animation-using-apng-fileformat/) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/animation-maker

Aspose.Imaging Compress for .NET

Allows to compress the images, preserving the quality.

See compress landing pages (https://products.aspose.com/imaging/net/compress/) for more details and examples.

Live demo available at https://products.aspose.app/imaging/image-compress

FAQ

Is it possible to use several plug-in licenses ?

Yes, it's possible and you may apply plug-in licenses incrementally combining required by you features.

What happens, if I use API entries, which are not licensed under purchased plug-in license ?

The library will work in the trial mode.

How may I know, which API entries are suitable for my plug-in license ?

Please learn the examples.

You may order available plug-in licenses here (https://purchase.aspose.market/)

Need more details ?
We've collected them at https://docs.aspose.com/display/imagingnet/Home
